bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Amherst County was formed in 1761 from Albemarle County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Amherst County (Va.) Loose Free Negro Papers, 1844-1860, consist of rough drafts of free negro registrations and copies of Amherst County registrations that would have been handed out to the free person to carry to prove free status. One 1851 register is from Lynchburg and is marked through with the word "Removed."
These items were probably found loose in the Amherst County (Va.) Register of Free Negroes, 1822-1864.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Amherst County Free Negro and Slave Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia web site.
